001package imagingbook.pub.color.edge;
002
003import java.awt.Point;
004import java.util.ArrayList;
005import java.util.Arrays;
006import java.util.Iterator;
007import java.util.List;
008
009import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
010import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
011
012/**
013 * Represents a chain of connected edge points.
014 * @author WB
015 *
016 */
017public class EdgeTrace implements Iterable<PntInt> {
018        
019        private final ArrayList<PntInt> edgePoints;
020        
021        public EdgeTrace() {
022                this.edgePoints = new ArrayList<>();
023        }
024        
025        public int size() {
026                return edgePoints.size();
027        }
028        
029        public void addPoint(PntInt p) {
030                edgePoints.add(p);
031        }
032        
033        public PntInt getPoint(int idx) {
034                return (idx >= 0 && idx < edgePoints.size()) ? 
035                                edgePoints.get(idx) : null;
036        }
037        
038        public PntInt[] getPointArray() {
039                return edgePoints.toArray(new PntInt[0]);
040        }
041
042        @Override
043        public Iterator<PntInt> iterator() {
044                return edgePoints.iterator();
045        }
046        
047        
048        /**
049         * For backward compatibility only.
050         * @return a list of AWT {@link Point} instances.
051         */
052        protected List<Point> getAwtPoints() {
053                List<Point> awtPoints = new ArrayList<>();
054                for (PntInt p : edgePoints) {
055                        awtPoints.add(new Point(p.x, p.y));
056                }
057                return awtPoints;
058        }
059        
060        @Override
061        public String toString() {
062                return String.format("%s: start=%s length=%d", 
063                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getPoint(0).toString(), size());
064        }
065        
066        // ---------------------------------------------------------
067        
068        public static void main(String[] args) {
069                EdgeTrace trace = new EdgeTrace();
070                trace.addPoint(PntInt.from(1,2));
071                trace.addPoint(PntInt.from(3,4));
072                trace.addPoint(PntInt.from(5,6));
073                
074                for (Pnt2d p : trace) {
075                        System.out.println(p);
076                }
077                
078                System.out.println();
079                trace.addPoint(PntInt.from(7,8));
080                
081                for (PntInt p : trace.getPointArray()) {
082                        System.out.println(p);
083                }
084                
085                System.out.println();
086                for (Point p : trace.getAwtPoints()) {
087                        System.out.println(p);
088                }
089                
090                System.out.println(trace.getPoint(3));
091                System.out.println(trace.getPoint(4));
092                
093                PntInt[] copy = Arrays.copyOfRange(trace.getPointArray(),0, 7);
094                System.out.println(copy.length);
095                for (PntInt p : copy) {
096                        System.out.println(p);
097                }
098        }
099
100}
